body_content.explanation: If a bird preens or preens itself, it cleans and arranges its feathers using its beak.
to spend time making yourself look attractive:
examples: Roald always spends ages preening (himself) before he goes out.

body_content.explanation: to feel very proud or satisfied with yourself because of an action or quality:
examples: The government is publicly preening itself on the latest trade figures.
The company preened itself for having taken on so many new employees last year.
I preened myself at my own foresight in buying the work while the artist was still unknown.
He strides around the office preening himself and puffing his chest out.
She preened herself a little at the description of her "flawless skin".
